alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 1:55PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Slow Moving Band Of Moderate Snow And Reduced Visibility... A slow moving band of moderate to briefly heavy snow and reduced visibility will continue across portions of northeast New York and the northwest and north central sections of Vermont through 400 pm. Areas most likely to see this band of snow produce an inch or less of snow in a short period of time and visibility reduced under a mile include northeast Essex County and southeast Clinton County in New York as well as Chittenden, Lamoille, Addison, and Washington counties in Vermont. The band has produced visibility as low as a quarter mile and up to a half inch of snow in a short period of time. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Remember conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads and reduced visibilities. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
